climbs.name: Tearjerker
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, Steve Haire, Mark Colby

content.description: Slabby start and some interesting face moves up high
content.protection: First pitch 11 bolts + chains   Second unknown bolts
content.location: Next line of bolts a few feet right of "Grief Relief"

content.description:
This is the bolted line on the left side of the face.  It starts about 25' above the base of the formation on a small platform with a tree and some cactus.  

  You may need to replace the rap' anchor webbing. (OK 11/15)
content.protection:
8 bolts plus anchors.  You may want gear to improve your belay anchor and perhaps some in the crack before the first bolt. 

  The anchors are set back from the edge and webbing holds a rap' ring out at the lip.  Maybe you should just belay from the top to simplify life?
content.location: Left side of the face, starting from the balcony belay.

content.description:
This is not my route, but if you're collecting the whole series you can stop here on the walk in for a warm-up.   

  2 routes leave from this balcony belay (see Beta photo); Hanging Gardens' is on the left skyline, following the cracks, all gear.  A little runout at the top, but the angle drops off and the holds are great.  The anchor bolts have webbing and a single rap' ring.  You may want to bring a few runners to replace the old ones.  (Good shape Nov 2015), or you could rap off the back anchor for A Cryin' and A Humpin'. 

  I'd say that both these routes would favor belaying from the top since it would be tight on the belay stance and the rope would likely be in the way.
content.protection: Gear. I placed med nuts and small-#2 Camalot.
content.location: This is on the left side of the formation and climbs from a balcony about 25 feet above the base.

content.description: The crux is lower on the route. #2 Camalot between 4th and 5th bolt. The runout here is on hard 5.9 slab and a fall here would land you near the base!
content.protection: 12 Draws, #2 Camalot. Belay from 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Downclimb or rap from chains for 'Cryin And Humpin'

content.description:
From the old Summit Hut guide: "a steep blank dihedral. Face climb up and right, then back to Jonah's Whale". 

  From Steiger: "A desperate series of well protected moves is found in the initial dihedral; the rest is inconsequential." 

  See EFR's guide for topo photo.
content.location: Obvious left-facing dihedral near center of formation.

content.description: If you don't want to lead this route (and I wouldn't), it can be toproped from the anchors for "Tearjerker".  Begin by bushwhacking through the small forest that has erupted at the base of this route.  May I recommend the "Fiutt" method of ascending the first moves--the tree has been tested to hold at least 160 pounds.  Bouldery start leads to thin slab.  Long runout between 3rd and 4th bolts gets the R rating.  Runout is on some pretty slabby moves.  Above the slab is another section of hard face climbing up a left-facing corner.  Finally, some more slabby face to the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts & chains.  All you need are quickdraws but you might consider bringing a chainsaw, machete, or weedwhacker for the approach.
content.location: Just right of "Tearjerker", this is the third bolted line on the main face.  If you are surrounded by trees and bushes, you're in the right spot.

content.description: Not my route, but I have this beta photo to round out the database.
content.protection: ~8 bolts, plus 2 bolt anchor directly at top. (There are 4 anchors on top.)
content.location: NW corner on the overhanging (back) side of the formation.  Visible on the walk in.

content.description: The crux is bolted. Not that great a route, but it gets a star with the bolted finish of "Grief Relief." Finishing on the upper bolted face left of chimney extends this climb to approx. 110ft.
content.location: Right angling route that shares two lead bolts with "Grief Relief." Down climb or rap from 'Cryin Humpin' chains.
